message.content:
{"steps":[{"output":"\lim_{x \to 1^{-}} f(x) = 2","explanation":"Step 1 [Left-hand limit]:
- As \(x\) approaches 1 from the left (\(x \to 1^{-}\)), the graph approaches the value 2. Thus, \(\lim_{x \to 1^{-}} f(x) = 2\)."},{"output":"\lim_{x \to 1^{+}} f(x) = 1","explanation":"Step 2 [Right-hand limit]:
- As \(x\) approaches 1 from the right (\(x \to 1^{+}\)), the graph approaches the value 1. Thus, \(\lim_{x \to 1^{+}} f(x) = 1\)."},{"output":"\lim_{x \to 1^{-}} f(x) + \lim_{x \to 1^{+}} f(x) = 2 + 1 = 3","explanation":"Step 3 [Summation of limits]:
- Add the left-hand limit and the right-hand limit: \(2 + 1 = 3\)."}],"final_answer":"\MC: boxed{3}"}
